ds_id: Meta Will Launch Twitter Competitor In Mid-July: Report@Forbes@2023-06-23 17:34:29.954825@Meta
data_content: Meta, Facebook's parent company, plans to launch its short-form blogging service, internally known as Project 92 or Threads, in mid-July, according to a report from The Verge. Meta intends to promote Threads within Instagram, aiming to attract "tens of millions" of users within months. The company is reportedly appealing to major celebrities to join Threads as a "sanely run" platform, positioning itself as a more responsible alternative to Twitter. Threads is being touted as a "decentralized" social media network with potential integrations with the social media platform Mastodon. The announcement has sparked a war of words between Meta's Mark Zuckerberg and Twitter owner Elon Musk.
